website_summaries.verdict: These multipurpose silicone molds are ideal if you prefer the look or feel of square shot glasses.
pros: Durable silicone molds are dishwasher, microwave, oven, and freezer safe
High-gloss surface allows for easy release
Large cavities hold a full shot
Makes 6 large shot glasses per tray
cons: Some feel that the walls are too thick for chocolate shot glasses

customer_reviews.title: Works well, just takes some "McGyvering"
customer_reviews.text: Good size and the silicone removes easily. I plan to use this for both frozen and 'baked' designs. Only problem I have run into thus far, the design requires you to fill the container to the absolute top, which thereby makes it impossible to get into the freezer without making a mess. Two options I am toying with. . .filling it on a small baking tray for stability, or you have to clear space and 'top it off' once already in the freezer. If not filled to brim with water, the bottom melts out rather quickly...real quick actually with room temperature tequila, lol!
customer_reviews.author: TripsPlusOneTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, must have, might get more
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My wife thinks I am crazy but I love to take an ice cold shot and then throw the “shot glass” into the pool. Awesome at a party. It dose take about two minutes to reset the ice cube tray to be ready for next time. I like to pour a shot into an ice shot glass, and leave it in a glass to make your favorite cold cocktail.

customer_reviews.title: Mu girlfriend loves this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! My girlfriend loved this thing. I think she made shot glasses out of everything from mints to chocolate. Wish it came with basic instructions for baking temps/times but trial and error didn't result in anything unusable. Mints can be put in whole but you gotta alternate which molds you use and wait till they melt a bit and form before you can load of the others. She didn't try blending the mints into a powered in a blender but it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Tara

customer_reviews.title: Fun product, a big hit at parties
customer_reviews.text: Fun product, a big hit at parties! Kind of hard to get the frozen part out but after a little practice I got better and faster at it. TIP - stock up in your freezer because if you’re friends are any fun you’ll go through 6 shots quick and it sucks to have to wait for more to freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah M.

customer_reviews.title: Jolly rancher shotglasses
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. We started with jolly rancher shot glasses. Our last project was cookie dough shot glasses that we brush with melted chocolate then fill with ice cream and topping
customer_reviews.author: cheri

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and ultra handy
customer_reviews.text: I blew my friends minds with these, I would also freeze the liquor that you're pouring in to presume the cube for multiple drinks
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun little gift we purchased and have now used several times. The durability has held up very well and is easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: vendor did gd job to get it out fast..very hi quality item.

customer_reviews.title: Made sure they were level and worked them out easy! Added things as we got bave
customer_reviews.text: Shots were a hit at the party. Just made plenty before hand. Made sure they were level and worked them out easy! Added things as we got bave! Great buy!

customer_reviews.title: Yassss

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected no issue pushing out the ice, it hold any drink I put in it. You can also use the other side if you just want and Ice block!

customer_reviews.title: Works well but chill the beverage
customer_reviews.text: They do come out of the mold semi easily and are a nice conversation piece. However make sure you chill your alcohol or it will melt out the bottom VERY quickly

customer_reviews.title: Ighh
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, but (naturally) the ice doesn’t melt evenly and the bottoms of the ice glasses just aren’t as thin I as they could be.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: Who knew shots could get better?
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic to make hard candy shot glasses for a party. Everyone was thrilled to have their own flavor. However, found out soft candies do not work, at least not in the traditional technique.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them. Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, poor execution. They're extremely flimsy and will spill when you move them to the freezer. To inconvenient to be useful.

customer_reviews.title: This worked really great! I will say that using water or juice ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked really great! I will say that using water or juice as a shot glass is good in theory but it does melt pretty quickly or gets real sticky with juice. Totally worth it though!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Good use for melted cheese and liquid to freeze or ...
customer_reviews.text: Good use for melted cheese and liquid to freeze or cool down. But baking in is very difficult. I tried baking cookies in there but each time the cookie doesn't back on the inside. The silicone is too thick and stops the heat from cooking the cookie. Idk if I'm doing something wrong or what. I do enjoy it though.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R.

customer_reviews.title: They easily pop out of the tray
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my brother in law, and he LOVES them!They easily pop out of the tray, and make for a fun drinking experience!

customer_reviews.title: and work just fine for their intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this for the price, I saw people complain about the size of the glass, well they are a novelty, and work just fine for their intended purpose. We are buying more, and returned a set of 4 that were 12$, and are using these instead. Yes, are there bigger ones? OF course, but why spend that much on an item when this works just as well? Buy these, a fun investment of less than $10

customer_reviews.title: but taking out the ice is very easy. If you are looking for ice shot glasses ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as you expect it. Putting it into the freezer filled with water is a little tricky because it is silicone and moves quite a lot, but taking out the ice is very easy. If you are looking for ice shot glasses this product does it very well and is a strong and thick silicone mold.
